answers.answer: I would think its ok because you can always go into the emergency room if you need to.
I thought being high risk appointments are every 2 weeks
it depends on your ob. I'm high risk and I used to go every month but when I moved states and switched ob's they have me going every week. It just depends where you live and the doctor.

question: I just found out yesterday that I am pregnant. I have type 2 Diabetes and high blood pressure. When I called to set up and appointment and told them that I has just been in the ER yesterday for my glucosw being 419 and that I have high blood pressure they scheduled me any appointment a month out should I look for another OB or is this okay being hight risk?
title: Any high risk pregnancies????
